content.description:
The rate at which a baby bird gains weight is proportional to the difference between its adult weight and its current weight. At time t = 0, when the bird is first weighed, its weight is 20 grams. If B(t) is the weight of the bird, in grams, at time t days after it is first weighed, then <math> <semantics> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>b</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>5</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>100</mn> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mi>B</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaadaWcaa qaaiaadsgacaWGIbaabaGaamizaiaadshaaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaa caaIXaaabaGaaGynaaaacaGGOaGaaGymaiaaicdacaaIWaGaeyOeI0 IaamOqaiaacMcaaeaaaaaa@418B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

Let y = B(t) be the solution to the differential equation above with initial condition B(0) = 20.
content.question: Is the bird gaining weight faster when it weighs 40 grams or when it weighs 70 grams? Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: Is the bird gaining weight faster when it weighs 40 grams or when it weighs 70 grams? Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
